original_definition: 'end-user' means a consumer buying or expected to buy a household tumble drier;
generated_definition: 'end-user' means a person using the household tumble drier for their intended purpose, including normal use, programming, and unloading.

Article 2: ‘off-mode’ means a condition where the household tumble drier is switched off using appliance controls or switches accessible to and intended for operation by the end-user during normal use to attain the lowest power consumption that may persist for an indefinite time while the household tumble drier is connected to a power source and used in accordance with the supplier’s instructions; where there is no control or switch accessible to the end-user, ‘off-mode’ means the condition reached after the household tumble drier reverts to a steady-state power consumption on its own;

‘off-mode’ means a condition where thehousehold tumble drieris switched off using appliance controls or switches accessible to and intended for operation by theend-user during normal use to attain the lowest power consumption that may persist for an indefinite time while the household tumble drier is connected to a power source and used in accordance with the supplier’s instructions; where there is no control or switch accessible to the end-user, ‘off-mode’ means the condition reached after the household tumble drier reverts to a steady-state power consumption on its own;
‘end-user’ means a consumer buying or expected to buy a household tumble drier;
‘programme time’ means the time that elapses from the initiation of the programme until the completion of the programme, excluding anyend-user programmed delay;
‘programme time’ means the time that elapses from the initiation of the programme until the completion of the programme, excluding any end-user programmed delay;

‘left-on mode’ means the lowest power consumption mode that may persist for an indefinite time after completion of theprogrammewithout any further intervention by theend-userbesides unloading of thehousehold tumble drier;

‘left-on mode’ means the lowest power consumption mode that may persist for an indefinite time after completion of the programme without any further intervention by the end-user besides unloading of the household tumble drier;
‘end-user’ means a consumer buying or expected to buy ahousehold tumble drier;
Article 4: household tumble driers offered for sale, hire or hire-purchase where theend-user cannot be expected to see the product displayed, as specified in Article 7 of Directive 2010/30/EU, are marketed with the information provided by suppliers in accordance with Annex IV to this Regulation;

household tumble driers offered for sale, hire or hire-purchase where the end-user cannot be expected to see the product displayed, as specified in Article 7 of Directive 2010/30/EU, are marketed with the information provided by suppliers in accordance with Annex IV to this Regulation;
Article 10: Information to be provided in cases where end-users cannot be expected to see the product displayed
